Yi /Kami camera bait and switch
text:
I just received this email from Kami. Being an owner of multiple cameras they will apparently soon become great paperweights. Any thoughts on how to enable them locally. It’s so frustrating to purchase a product only for it to be literally castrated. I’m starting to dislike the cloud of things. Anyone else have this experience with another product? ————- After years of growing, we are at the point that our systems can no longer support free 6 second video storage for all our users.

If you have been using our app to review your videos, we're glad to let you know that we have Cloud Plans that support this - and there are many new features. Benefits of Cloud plans: See full videos of what you missed in the last 30 days Smart AI detection of human, pets and vehicles Add more devices for a cloud protected home Still, we know that this is a disruptive change, and we want to help with this transition in any way we can.

Ask HN: How do you find a new job?
text:
Hey, I'm looking for a new gig in a small company. I've been mainly chased until now, which landed me series of jobs that others wanted me to do, rather than something that truly inspired me to get out of bed.

Linkedin jobs mostly seem garbage, is there a more adapter place where people find technology jobs?

Ask HN: Smart ways to look at fairly small ($15-30k) business investment?
text:
Hey HN -

Due to some obscure industry connections, I've come upon a very solid opportunity to acquire an extremely rare piece of unusual manufacturing equipment that's a step or two away from essentially printing money. I'm obviously not going to be super specific, but it's also not a piece of gear that a lot of other people know how to use; but I fortunately have a lot of education and experience in.

That being said; I've personally never actually lent money of any kind before, much less for a business idea. Honestly - I'll be the first to admit I'm not knowledgable in that regard.

I've assembled together a small business plan with manufacturing costs and profits, sources to back up the dire need for this particular product, etc; but I personally have little idea where to go next, and time is of the absolute and utmost essence.

Where is the best place to turn for a fairly small business investment like this? Should I be looking for a personal investment? Should I be turning to a bank?

Thanks for any and all advice, I'm hoping this community is a decent resource to get some good guidance.

Ask HN: Which small company engineering team blogs do you follow?
text: We always see the blog posts of the big companies, but not that often of the smaller ones. The problems that are being solved are different, and it would be interesting for a lot of people to see solutions at their scale.

Ask HN: Does Stage Manager Compete with Notifications?
text:
If you have really good notifications from various apps, then it seems that you can get by with using each app in full screen mode.

And so it seems Stage Manager is more compelling when the notifications from apps aren't that good.

Is this so?
